summary: The 'Stop Harassing Owners of Rifles Today Act' (SHORT Act) aims to amend the National Firearms Act of 1934. Key provisions include removing short-barreled rifles and shotguns from the definition of firearms, eliminating disparate treatment for lawful use of these weapons, and preempting certain state laws related to their taxation, marking, and registration. It also mandates the destruction of specific records related to these firearms held by the Attorney General.
